identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

abstract.p: New York City police report that man arrested on charges of possessing crack cocaine in Queens had seizure and died while in custody (S)

block.p: A man arrested on charges of possessing crack cocaine in Queens yesterday had a seizure and died while in custody, the police said. The cause of the seizure was unclear; the medical examiner is to determine if the man ingested cocaine, said Officer Cheryl Cox, a police spokeswoman.

A man arrested on charges of possessing crack cocaine in Queens yesterday had a seizure and died while in custody, the police said. The cause of the seizure was unclear; the medical examiner is to determine if the man ingested cocaine, said Officer Cheryl Cox, a police spokeswoman.

The man, whose identity was not known last night, and another man, David Mahabeer, 32, and a woman, Laura Lafata, 34, were arrested at 3:30 p.m. at 134th Street and Rockaway Boulevard in South Ozone Park and charged with drug possession. The unidentified man was dead on arrival at Mary Immaculate Hospital at 7:20 p.m., Officer Cox said.
